resources.string: Walk or run if you flick the stick
Jump, double jump, or footstool if close enough to opponent and currently in the air
Shield/Guard: A bubble that blocks all attacks. It shrinks when hit, becoming less effective. Likely causing a shield-poke.
Spot-dodge - For a short moment evade any attacks or grabs, can be cancelled into attacks earlier than the animation ends

Roll - You are immune to damage only in the middle of the animation as you move left or right. Becomes stale with frequent use. There are punish windows at the beginning and end that grow when stale. \n\nDirectional Airdodge - similar to roll, but can go in 8 directions. (cannot perform any actions until the character falls a set distance after the input)
Jab and jab combo with consecutive presses or holding the button, varies between characters
Tilt attack - Stronger than jab with emphasis on direction chosen. Good for combos and quick punish options
Tilt attack - Stronger than jab with emphasis on direction chosen. Good for combos and quick punish options
Smash attack - Kill move. Similar to tilt attack, but with more startup time and much more knockback potential

Special attack - Signature moves of your character. With certain exceptions, there are 4 per character.\n\nThese can be anything and are a prime example for showing what a character has to offer in terms of strategic options and playstyles.
Grab button or Shield button + Attack button
Grab - Core staple of any fighting game. It goes through shield and allows you to either pummel or throw your opponent in one of 4 directions you input while holding them.
